author: Special Correspondent
text:
After Pongal, buses will ply to Villupuram, Chennai and other cities, says Minister

Minister for Transport, Fisheries and Backward Classes Welfare P.R.Siva on Saturday said new bus services to several destinations in Tamil Nadu would be introduced after necessary approvals.

Addressing reporters, Mr. Siva said the Tamil Nadu Transport Department in principle agreed to the proposals of Puducherry Transport Corporation.

Mr. Siva said after Pongal, new services to Villupuram, Chennai and other cities would be started. New buses would also be introduced to connect Karaikal with Thiruchendur, Madurai, Palani, Tiruchi, Salem and Kumbakonam.

New Jipmer branch

The Minister said all steps have been taken for the early commissioning of a branch of Jawaharlal Institute of Post Graduate Medical Education and Research (Jipmer) at Karaikal. The branch of the medical college-cum-hospital of Jipmer will be launched from the next academic year.

He also pointed out that the Union Territory administration had allotted land to the Institute for establishing its branch.

Chief Minister N. Rangasamy would lay foundation stone soon for the construction of new building.

The Minister also said the government had been taking consistent efforts to facilitate early release of nine Karaikal fishermen who were captured by Sri Lankan Navy. He expressed hope that they would be released early.

Mr. Rangasamy had written a letter to the Union Government in this regard and member of Parliament R.Radhakrishnan had also taken up the matter, he added.
title: New bus services to TN destinations on the cards
